workflow.name: Automated compliance control scoring with CyberPulse, GPT-4o & Google Sheets
workflow.description:
**What this template does**

Batch-evaluates compliance controls from Google Sheets using the CyberPulse Compliance API. Each control is scored, mapped to selected frameworks, enriched with crosswalk mappings, and summarized with AI-generated findings and recommendations.

**How it works**

Read from Sheets ‚Üí Build control text (response_text + implementation_notes) ‚Üí CyberPulse Compliance (scoring, mapping, AI summary) ‚Üí Normalize ‚Üí Append results to Sheets.

**Setup (5‚Äì10 min)**

Add Google Sheets + CyberPulse HTTP Header Auth credentials.

Replace YOUR_SHEET_ID and sheet names.

Provide your Crosswalk JSON URL (raw GitHub or API endpoint) or use this url: https://www.cyberpulsesolutions.com/xw.json

Select frameworks to evaluate against.

Run a small test, then full batch.

**CyberPulse API (required for production)**

Use hosted scoring/mapping (no local ML code).

Create a CyberPulse HTTP Header Auth credential with API Key.

In the node: paste Crosswalk URL, select frameworks, set credential.

For large sheets, add a short Wait or reduce batch size.

**Input columns**

control_id

control_description

response_text

implementation_notes 

evidence_url_1 ‚Ä¶ evidence_url_4 

**Output columns**

status

evaluation

score

confidence

rationale

categories

evidence_count

mapped_count

mapping_flat

frameworks_selected

engine_version

ai_summary

ai_findings (3 per control)

ai_recommendations (3 per control)

**Troubleshooting**

No rows ‚Üí check sheet ID and range.

Empty mappings ‚Üí verify Crosswalk URL.

Write errors ‚Üí confirm results sheet + permissions.

**Learn more about CyberPulse Compliance Agent:**

https://www.cyberpulsesolutions.com/solutions/compliance-agent

**Start free:**

https://www.cyberpulsesolutions.com/pricing

Email: info@cyberpulsesolutions.com

values.content:
=Use only the provided fields. Do not invent evidence, numbers, or frameworks.
Return a JSON object with keys exactly:
- ai_summary (string)
- ai_findings (array of 3 short strings), no bullets, no dashes, no numbering, no checkboxes.
- ai_recommendations (array of 3 short, actionable strings), no bullets, no dashes, no numbering, no checkboxes.
No other keys.

={
  "timestamp": "{{ $('Edit Fields').item.json.timestamp }}",
  "control_id": "{{ $('Edit Fields').item.json.control_id }}",
  "control_description": "{{ $('Edit Fields').item.json.control_description }}",
  "response_text": "{{ $('Edit Fields').item.json.response_text }}",
  "implementation_notes": "{{$json.implementation_notes || ''}}",

  "status": "{{$json.status}}",
  "evaluation": "{{$json.evaluation}}",
  "score": {{ +$json.score }},
  "confidence": {{ +$json.confidence }},
  "rationale": "{{$json.rationale}}",

  "evidence_count": {{
  Array.isArray($json.evidence)
    ? $json.evidence.filter(u => u && String(u).trim()).length
    : ([
        $json.evidence_url_1,
        $json.evidence_url_2,
        $json.evidence_url_3,
        $json.evidence_url_4
      ].filter(u => u && String(u).trim()).length || ($json.evidence_count ?? 0))
}},

  "mapped_count": {{ Array.isArray($json.mapped_requirements) ? $json.mapped_requirements.length : ($json.mapped_count ?? 0) }},
  "mapping_flat": "{{ Array.isArray($json.mapped_requirements) ? $json.mapped_requirements.map(m => [m.framework, m.clause, m.title].filter(Boolean).join(': ')).join(' | ') : ($json.mapping_flat || '') }}",
  "categories": "{{ Array.isArray($json.categories) ? $json.categories.join(', ') : ($json.categories || '') }}",
  "frameworks_selected": "{{ Array.isArray($json.mapped_requirements) ? [...new Set($json.mapped_requirements.map(m => m.framework).filter(Boolean))].join(', ') : ($json.frameworks_selected || '') }}",
  "engine_version": "{{$json.engine_version || ''}}",

  "format_instructions": "Return ai_summary exactly as: 'Status: {status}. Evaluation: {evaluation}. Score: {score}. Confidence: {confidence}. Evidence items: {evidence_count}. Categories: {categories}. Mappings: {mapping_flat}'. Then return ai_findings as a single string with 3 short bullets (prefix each with '‚Ä¢ ') grounded in rationale/categories. Then return ai_recommendations as a single string with 3 short, actionable bullets (prefix each with '‚Ä¢ ') tied to mapping_flat and evidence_count. Also compute priority, next_action, evidence_gap_flag, policy_gap_flag using the rules below.\n\nRules:\n- priority:\n  - P1 if (status == 'Non-Compliant' && mapped_count >= 3) OR (score < 50 && evidence_count == 0)\n  - P2 if (status in ['Non-Compliant','Partial'] && (score >= 50 && score < 75)) OR (evidence_count <= 1)\n  - P3 if (status == 'Compliant' && (confidence < 60 || evidence_count < 2))\n  - else P4\n- next_action:\n  - 'implement' if status == 'Non-Compliant'\n  - 'remediate' if status == 'Partial'\n  - 'monitor' if status == 'Compliant' and (confidence < 60 || evidence_count < 2)\n  - else 'review'\n- evidence_gap_flag: 'yes' if evidence_count == 0 OR evidence_count == 1, else 'no'\n- policy_gap_flag: 'yes' if ('policy' appears in (response_text or rationale) case-insensitive) OR categories contains 'policy', else 'no'"
}

parameters.content:
üü¢ Manual Trigger ‚Äî Start/diagnostics

Receives POST and starts the run; echoes runId for tracing






















üü© Get row(s) in sheet ‚Äî Read inputs

Loads model/routing settings from
 the config sheet.

üü¶ Edit Fields ‚Äî Normalize columns

Maps incoming keys, trims text, and sets safe defaults.

üü® CyberPulse Compliance (Dev) ‚Äî Score + map

Scores and maps each control using control text + implementation notes + up to 4 evidence URLs and selected frameworks.
Outputs score (0‚Äì100), status, confidence, binary evaluation, categories, crosswalk mappings, and adds gaps/actions when evidence is weak or missing.

üü™ Loop Over Items ‚Äî Iterate per control

Iterates each control independently to run LLM ‚Üí parse ‚Üí append, preserving per-row context and emitting one result per input.

üü¶ Explain & Recommend (Message Model) ‚Äî Exec summary

Generates a strict-JSON executive summary‚Äîai_summary, three ai_findings, and three ai_recommendations‚Äîfrom the control‚Äôs status, score, confidence, categories, evidence, and framework mappings.

üüß Merge1 ‚Äî Combine model + original

Combines CyberPulse scoring/mapping with the LLM summary by position, producing one merged item per row.

üü® Parse + attach to each item ‚Äî Final shaping

Merges CyberPulse scores/mappings with the LLM output by index into a single unified row.

üü© Append row in sheet ‚Äî Write results

Appends one result row per item to the results sheet with core, scoring, mapping, and AI fields, leaving future columns blank.

What is CyberPulse Agent workflow ?

Automates evidence-aware control scoring (0‚Äì100) with deterministic gates and confidence from evidence/text quality.
Reads controls from Google Sheets (text, up to 4 evidence URLs, notes) and classifies, scores, and maps via the CyberPulse node.
Generates board-ready AI outputs per control: one-paragraph summary, 3 findings, and 3 actionable recommendations.
Writes normalized, analytics-ready rows back to a results sheet with flattened framework mappings and detected categories.
Covers ISO 27001, NIST CSF, SOC 2, PCI DSS, Essential Eight, GDPR; secure, scalable in n8n with tunable weights/thresholds.

user.name: Adnan Tariq
user.bio:
Founder of CYBERPULSE AI ‚Äî helping security teams and SMEs eliminate repetitive tasks through modular n8n automations. I build workflows for vulnerability triage, compliance reporting, threat intel, and Red/Blue/GRC ops. Book a session if you'd like custom automation for your use case.

https://linkedin.com/in/adnan-tariq-4b2a1a47

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
